results.content: I'm learning to be a Data Scientist in my work and this course was a great overview. Enjoyed the delve into the history and the holistic view made really accessible to me in placing ML in context. Plenty of links to further reading too. David is clearly a passionate and knowledgeable teacher so overall would highly recommend as an intro!

results.content: Great introduction to ML - I really appreciate the effort put into this, particular the bonus content using Python. Definitely got my feet wet and ready to dive in fully!

results.content: The Course was well explanatory and full with relative examples

results.content: A good course, but it feels a bit unbalanced when it comes to the focus of themes. The longer portions on Computer Science basics and historical aspects such as the development of computational power could maybe be sacrificed to go a bit more into detail on the Machine Learning aspects. The bonus part of the lecture resulted in +1 star albeit similar to the core lecture scratching at the surface. I understand the intention of referring to further readings, but then maybe doing less breadth and a bit more depth would be the way to go (and then to refer to further reading for the breadth).
results.content_html: A good course, but it feels a bit unbalanced when it comes to the focus of themes. The longer portions on Computer Science basics and historical aspects such as the development of computational power could maybe be sacrificed to go a bit more into detail on the Machine Learning aspects. I understand the intention of referring to further readings, but then maybe doing less breadth and a bit more depth would be the way to go (and then to refer to further reading for the breadth).

results.content:
An excellent Primer into ML for anyone keen to pick up the concepts. The lecturer is extremely knowledgeable and is able to ensure that the course material remains relatable and exciting. Also appreciate all of the accompanying links and additional reading/ course material.

I would recommend this as an introductory course to anyone wanting to explore machine learning.
results.content_html:
